page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area you are investigating lies just south of the village of Glenavy, with a somewhat larger village, Crumlin, another 3 miles north. A railway line, and an approach road to BELFAST AIRPORT (Aldergrove) run parallel to each other in a north-south direction through the eastern part of the area. These apart, it is entirely rural. BELFAST is some 15 miles away, and the busy town of LISBURN some 9 miles. The land is largely GRASSLAND intensively cultivated and fertilised, and beef and milk production have for long been the economic mainstay. Milk production has had a setback due to the "milk-lake" in the European Economic Community, and local farmers in 1985 are having to make painful adjustments. (CONT'D..)
